title: Jeremy A. Dubrulle
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Jeremy.


Thanks for visiting my website fellow scientist ‚Äì Let‚Äôs dive together in the incredible world of (Bacterio)Phages! Here you‚Äôll find everything you want to know about me (I hope!)

I‚Äôm a PhD student in the Fineran group at the University of Otago, Dunedin, New Zealand. I study plasmid-borne antibiotic resistance and phage defense systems in the context of Phage Therapy. I got into phages reading the Good Virus (Tom Ireland) and I‚Äôve stucked with them! How cool is it to study LEM-looking like viruses everyday?
I‚Äôm a big fan of adventuring and exploring nature‚Äôs craziest evolution. I‚Äôm always on the hunt for some exploration & finding out what natures has to offer! When it comes to work, I love the lab! Give me a petri dish of bacteria, and I‚Äôll make millions (of phages, of course!).
Fun fact, I grew up on Reunion Island - you won‚Äôt hear that everyday! I bet you a post-doc contract you can‚Äôt locate it on a map! Check it out: To Reunion Island blog
